newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Fire out, no injuries on Spanish-crewed trawler.
newsitem.headline: Fire out, no injuries on Spanish-crewed trawler.

text.p: Thirteen men were airlifted from a burning Spanish-crewed trawler off the Irish coast on Saturday after a major air and sea rescue operation.
Four others remained on board to tackle and extinguish the fire and take the trawler Shark into port, rescue workers said.

There were no reports of injuries in the emergency, which started early on Saturday morning after the Shark sent out a Mayday signal while battling heavy seas and gales some 120 miles off the west coast of Ireland.
Reports received by coastguards said the fire broke out in the wheelhouse. Two helicopters, two lifeboats and a number of other trawlers were diverted to the area.
Thirteen of the crew were taken by helicopter to the Irish Republic and the remaining four were taking the fishing boat into an Irish port.
